snippet: In India, candidates lucky enough to win elections can always use their position to recoup the investment — with interest.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Carnegie Endowment for International Peace executive Milan Vaishnav notes soaring costs of India's elections, with campaign spending expected to reach $5 billion in 2014 general election; holds that increasingly competitive politics and lax enforcement of campaign spending caps are driving rapid rise; warns that trend is having negative limiting effect on who is able to gain entry to politics.
lead_paragraph: In India, candidates lucky enough to win elections can always use their position to recoup the investment — with interest.
